channel.title: Multiple Tcp Clients?
channel.description: Hey, I want to use multiple tcp clients to connect to one socket. How would I do this i figured using an array well If anyone could help me I need this TcpClient MyClient = new TcpClient(); converted to make multiple clients

item.title: Multiple Tcp Clients?
item.dc:creator: @foolet foolet
item.description:
@foolet wrote:

Na i needed to use int.parse and I fixed everything Lock please?

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Tcp Clients?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

You’d do something like this:

for(int i = 0;i  < myClients.Length; i++)
{
    myClients[i].Connect(theTextBox.Text, 12345);
}

Read full topic

Error 2 Argument '1': cannot convert from 'System.Windows.Forms.ListBox' to 'System.Net.IPAddress[]'

I have a

newText.Parent = this;
newText.Size = new Size(200, 2 * Font.Height);
newText.Location = new Point(10, 55);
Now i want to place the results from that
in

        MyClient[i].Connect("HERE", port);

so the user can specify what ip address.

but it errors[/quote]

item.title: Multiple Tcp Clients?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“shangtsung1, post:14, topic:268424”]TcpListener socketAccepter = new TcpListener(IPAddress.Any, THEPORT);
socketAccepter.Start();
while (true)
{
TcpClient tcpClient = socketAccepter.AcceptTcpClient();
//now just throw your tcpclient into an array here
}[/quote]

[quote=“foolet, post:1, topic:268424”]Hey, I want to use multiple tcp clients to connect to one socket. How would I do this i figured using an array well If anyone could help me I need this
TcpClient MyClient = new TcpClient(); converted to make multiple clients[/quote]

I assume you want to connect to the same server with multiple clients. I guess you’d need something like:

TcpClient[] myClients = new TcpClient[clients];
for(int i = 0;i  < clients; i++)
{
    myClients[i] = new TcpClient();
    // connect here
}

Read full topic

socketAccepter.Start();
while (true)
{
TcpClient tcpClient = socketAccepter.AcceptTcpClient();
//now just throw your tcpclient into an array here
}

item.title: Multiple Tcp Clients?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“abrhm2119, post:7, topic:268424”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=354247.msg2714936#msg2714936 date=1237580186]

He never said what language it was. Looked to me like: Object obj = new Object();[/quote]
does that mean it is java? no, it means he is using an oop language.

[quote author=T4_ link=topic=354247.msg2714936#msg2714936 date=1237580186]
Also, I assumed he’s a Moparscapian; meaning it’s probably java…
[/quote]1. dont assume, although he probably is.
2. if it would have been java, he would have posted it in the java section.
3. regarding your ‘moparscapian’ comment, there is no standard TcpClient class in java, but there is in .NET.[/quote]
Yes, I understand that; but, the one of most popular Object Oriented Langs around here is Java.

  1. My mistake for assuming.
  2. Not necessarily, some people post in the wrong section.
  3. He could have made/found one.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Tcp Clients?
item.dc:creator: @abrhm2119 abrhm2119
item.description:
@abrhm2119 wrote:

T4_:

He never said what language it was. Looked to me like: Object obj = new Object();

does that mean it is java? no, it means he is using an oop language.

[quote=“T4_, post:6, topic:268424”]Also, I assumed he’s a Moparscapian; meaning it’s probably java…[/quote]1. dont assume, although he probably is.
2. if it would have been java, he would have posted it in the java section.
3. regarding your ‘moparscapian’ comment, there is no standard TcpClient class in java, but there is in .NET.

item.title: Multiple Tcp Clients?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“abrhm2119, post:5, topic:268424”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=354247.msg2714773#msg2714773 date=1237569754]

Hey, I want to use multiple tcp clients to connect to one socket. How would I do this i figured using an array well If anyone could help me I need this
TcpClient MyClient = new TcpClient(); converted to make multiple clients

What.

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/net/Socket.html

[/quote]do you not realize that this is C# and not java?

anyways, if you mean server,
if you have a max number of connections that you are going to connect, use an array(static), if not, use an arraylist(dynamic).[/quote]

He never said what language it was. Looked to me like: Object obj = new Object();

Also, I assumed he’s a Moparscapian; meaning it’s probably java…

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Tcp Clients?
item.dc:creator: @abrhm2119 abrhm2119
item.description:

[quote=“T4_, post:4, topic:268424”][quote author=foolet link=topic=354247.msg2714220#msg2714220 date=1237510872]
Hey, I want to use multiple tcp clients to connect to one socket. How would I do this i figured using an array well If anyone could help me I need this
TcpClient MyClient = new TcpClient(); converted to make multiple clients
[/quote]
What.

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/net/Socket.html[/quote]do you not realize that this is C# and not java?

anyways, if you mean server,
if you have a max number of connections that you are going to connect, use an array(static), if not, use an arraylist(dynamic).
